website_summaries.verdict: Portable, practical, and colorful. A great pick for outdoor gatherings like parties, reunions, and barbecues.
pros: Easy to transport for outdoor events, but can also be used in your kitchen
Comes in several fun colors, including bright red
cons: A little water tends to pool in the machine after use, requiring drainage prior to storage

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a couple of years ago and tho it still freezes ice the metal plating on the posts that freeze the ice has started flaking off leaving the ice inedible. I have carefully followed manufacturers instructions on cleaning and ONLY used filtered water... very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: katrine mcanulty

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money or hassle
customer_reviews.text: Bought this machine thinking I would be able to depend on it to produce quality ice. I used water from my reverse osmosis tap which is free of any kind of contaminate. I live alone and love to munch on ice and truthfully this machine makes the best ice. I cleaned it once a week with vinegar and noticed in the last few weeks that it's producing more and more black flecks in my ice. Now it's so bad that I am not using this machine anymore. I tried cleaning it with lemon juice and as a last resort used bleach. Nothing is getting the water lines completely clean. I am so disappointed.....
customer_reviews.author: Mariani Family

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. I got about 4.5 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was in love. It made ice and that was exactly what I needed. 5 months later, the bloom is definitely off the rose. The anodization on the chilling elements is flaming off and leaving bits of metal in the ice. When it’s making ice. I’ve had it going for 6 hours and I’ve gotten 4 dumps. I’m not sure what happened, maybe it got tired of making ice on demand, but I’m pretty bummed. For how much counter space this thing takes up, it’s a bust. It’s wheezing at me and I’m more than a little disappointed in the waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa S.

customer_reviews.title: It makes ice and does it well.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Makes ice fast. If your refrigerator ice maker is not great and you need more ice, or want a back up ice maker for parties it's worth the money. It payed for itself in six months of use. Keep it clean and make sure it has water in it before you turn it on and then make sure you empty it because it doesn't have an alarm for when it is done unfortunately so it just keeps trying to keep the ice cold and that uses energy and wears on the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Blockdaddy

customer_reviews.title: It’s soooo loud!!!  Must turn off at night!
customer_reviews.text: This makes delicious ice and quickly! However, this is so loud I’m sure it needs repair. The first one we purchased from this company lasted a couple of years. It was also much quieter. This one also fails to push the ice it makes all the way forward into the basket. This creates a problem as the machine has to be turned off and the ice manually moved. I think we just received a defective one. I recommend always purchasing the warranty for items like this.
customer_reviews.author: MrsMommyLoves7

customer_reviews.title: First one worked the second one didn't!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these in 2015 and it worked perfectly for over two years until two months ago when it finally died. Fortunately for me I bought the extended Warranty from Assurant and they quickly cut me a check for the full purchase price and I bought a second one to replace the old one. Unfortunately it only worked for one day and then it died. Regretfully the manufacturer is willing to honor their warranty but only if I will pay to ship the ice maker to them. I am trying to decide what I am going to do. Whatever you do get the extended warranty it is more than worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Wascalwy Wabbit

customer_reviews.title: 3 year life span, hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years (Amazon receipt says I ordered it in July of 2014) my baby has finally died. My brother had the same model and it stopped working after 6 months, but I took care of mine and got almost 3 years of pretty much constant use out of it. I'm knocking off a star for the difficulty in cleaning it- you can't really reach into the tray where the ice cubes freeze and it WILL grow undesirable ... stuff in there. Time to shop for a different model I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Moon Elf

customer_reviews.title: So far, it's works as needed
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted a crushed ice maker but those don't seem to be available. This one make 9 ice "cubes" at a time and at a good speed. I don't see much difference between the cube sizes but they are small enough to meet our needs. It's not whisper quiet but it's not bad either. It makes the most noise dumping the ice into the tray. Update: We've used it several times and it works like a charm
customer_reviews.author: SCTexan

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE...DO NOT BUY especially from this company!
customer_reviews.text: Very handy ice maker. I like it but the lights are not working correctly on it. Could be a little better for the amount of money. UPDATE.....My icemaker broke... it was still under warrenty...I called the company...They sent me the part...no directions, for ME to fix it! Now bear in mind that I am an old lady.....I do not know how to fix appliances! Part arrived. No directions! Called company again...They emailed directions. I had to call an engineer friend to put this part in. Installation was difficult... moving wires, etc. Machine doesn't seem to work correctly....BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Not a Great Product - 18 month review.
customer_reviews.text: Liked for the first 14 Months: Quantity of Ice Dislikes: I clean it once a week by scrubbing and running vinegar & water through it.Bulky to clean. The drain would barely allow water flow so I had to bail it out with a cup to clean it. Very difficult to clean up inside. The last few months had something red that kept running down the top right side. (Algae?) Today it was black. While searching for a new one I noticed that this unit has gone up by $90.00 in the past 18 months. Please try a different model or brand.
customer_reviews.author: Krups Cafe

customer_reviews.title: We've had 3 of these... I don't recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This machine is wonderful while it works, but unfortunately - it doesn't keep working. We've now had 3 of these... first one quit less than a year, the 2nd never worked (we got a replacement with no problem thanks to Amazon), and the 3rd lasted 1.5 years and just quit. We called NewAir and they said we weren't supposed to use distilled water (although we could not find that in the owner's manual), and they didn't offer any other help. We won't be choosing this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: linda_brewer

customer_reviews.title: Did not function appropriately.
customer_reviews.text: Returned product. Upon delivery, placed the ice maker on the counter undisturbed for well over 48 hours, without powering up, allowing for settling, as recommended. After several hours on, barely a handful of ice was made. Had the product functioned as designed, it would have been easy to use. The ability to have multiple sized cubes was a great concept. The noises made were by the dropping ice, as the bin remained virtually empty, the impact was a bit loud. I'm quite sure, had the machine generated more than a few cubes the noise would have been inconsequential. Not sure why warmth was a feature to be rated.
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: NewAir AI-100S 28-Pound Portable Ice Maker, Silver
customer_reviews.text: NewAir AI-100S 28-Pound Portable Ice Maker, : First two ice makers delivered did not work. Third ice maker only worked for a few months. Ice maker number 4 was replaced by NewAir after they determined it could not be repaired which took several months and multiple phone calls. New replacement ice maker number 5 . ..... worked for a few months and stopped working. Total of 5 ice makers in 1 1/2 years tells a lot about the product.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamteam

customer_reviews.title: Worked 3 days total
customer_reviews.text: I really loved the look of this item. I followed the instructions to the letter buy letting sit for a day prior to use. It worked beautiful for 3 days. The tray that is used to hold the water while freezing is in the down position. I called customer service from New Air and not helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: We are pleased with our new ice maker. It works great. We like that we can use purified water for our ice. It looks nice on the kitchen counter (about the size of a bread maker), but we know people that keep theirs on their porch. I empty the cube tray every couple of times (you can hear the ice drop into the bin that has cutouts, so you can drain off any excess water before removing it) and fill up gallon Ziploc bags and keep in the freezer. Note: The cubes may be small for some people as even the large size are not very large, but we are fine with them.
customer_reviews.author: J & K

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It makes great ice for eating. Only problem is it is LOUD. We use this everyday and our kitchen and living room are connected. When it is making ice, it's annoying and we have to turn up the TV a little. Sometimes the sensor doesn't read that the tray is full and it will keep making ice until the tray is full and so is the area where the ice is made. The ice tray holds about 3 30 oz. yeti's full of ice. perfect for an ice lover!!
customer_reviews.author: N. Maynor

customer_reviews.title: Great ice maker!!
customer_reviews.text: This ice maker is THE BEST!!! I took the advice of a previous reviewer and let it sit upright for 48 hours before plugging it in. I’ve had it for a few weeks now and I couldn’t be happier!!! The sound of the ice dropping into the basket reminds me of a dog shaking rain water off it’s coat! Lol! I started with medium ice cubes and just switched to large. My husband LOVES ice and he is in heaven!! It’s quite compact and one of the best purchase I’ve made!!
customer_reviews.author: robert kamphausen

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this Icemaker!!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a portable icemaker for my office, but didn't want to install a separate water line. The icemaker is the PERFECT alternative. I drink about five 24oz glasses of fluid a day and didn't want to leave the office all the time for ice. This icemaker makes large sized ice in about 10 minutes, so there's always ice available when I want it. The ONLY drawback is that the fan it a little noisy when making the ice, but not loud enough to be distracting. I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for several months now and LOVE it. fits on my counter and so easy to use. I use distilled water in mine because my tap water would yellow the cubes(I have well water with loads of iron ) while the amount of ice is like a regular tray it makes it rapidly (about 6 minutes) and continually. I bought it when the ice maker in my freezer stopped working due to sediment clogging the lines. It is quiet and I seldom hear it. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Markman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it says it will do. The only improvement to be made is that it would be nice if the ice container had refrigeration or insulation to keep the ice from melting and freezing together. I have a small apartment refrigerator and don't have the room for a bin (it can hold 2 small ice trays), so this machine chugs away 24/7. This is by no means a complaint, but merely a suggestion to improve it. Great product, I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jamesical

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy this ice maker is to use. I got it and let it sit overnight then added water and started making ice. Very user friendly. Put water in the bottom and it makes ice. Any melting drips back into the bottom to be used again. I just check it every evening to see if it needs water added. It does make noise when it makes and dumps the ice. This worked so well for us that I got my daughter one too.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda C

customer_reviews.title: Great. But breaks with in the first year, and uses a lot of great
customer_reviews.text: I love this ice maker. I love in a small apt with a small freezer. And I use a lot of ice. Just be aware that this item uses up a lotb of electricity. A lot. My electric bill went up 30 dollars a month just on this machine alone. Now I keep it off unless I need ice, and then I make the enough to bag some for freezer. Then turn it back off. I could have gotten ice trays! Btw, mine broke in under a year. So definitely buy a protection plan. You will need it. Other family had theirs break in inst ac year as well. too. Also. The perfect gift for an ice chewer
customer_reviews.author: Someone who bought.

customer_reviews.title: Great machine. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one I've had. Like anything else, they wear out after a year or two. The current one is going on 3. Check the water level, turn it on and it's spitting ice in about 6 minutes. It keeps up with our rum & cokes. You have to dump the water every few weeks to keep it clean but that's about it. We turn ours on every morning and let it run. The ice clumps together sometimes but is easily knocked apart.
customer_reviews.author: John Kelly

customer_reviews.title: I can clean it just fine with a soft cloth
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Ice Machine I have owned. The first one had a cleaning function, this does not, but I figure with an occasional TLC with some vinegar, I can clean it just fine with a soft cloth. The ice is tricky for these machines. They come out too runny/watery. The best way to use them is to fill them with cold water, preferably refrigerated water. Make some ice, I would get the ice basket full then dump it in the water underneath. The ice water will make some amazing ice, and in my opinion throwing the ice back that you don't use is better than waiting for it to melt. It makes the machine more functional.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Regret buying it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The first 3 times we used it worked great now I wanted it to use it and it takes for ever to make ice cubes and it's melting as fast as it can in the reserve basket. I don't know if I can say it makes 28lb either. I got 2 one gallon bags a day of ice. This product is totally misleading!!!! Not a happy costumer and I would give it a 0 rating
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Wheeler Sr.

customer_reviews.title: The compressor sounded like an airplane that was going to take off.
customer_reviews.text: I have come to the conclusion that these portable ice makers are all commodity and made with lower end components and shouldn't come with unrealistic expectations. My first one was a different brand and all it did was leak water and never got cold enough to form ice so back it went. This one has a larger capacity than others and NewAir is an American company so I took a chance. When I first plugged it in and it started to make ice, it sounded like a jet airplane was taking off. The compressor was buzzing so loudly it was ridiculous. Back to Amazon this terrible small appliance goes. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Sabin

customer_reviews.title: All day ice
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. Makes first batch of ice in 10-20 minutes. 6-8 ice "cubes" per batch. Makes a batch every 15-20 minutes. The ice container is not refrigerated so ice slowly melts after it is made. We just store the ice in a freezer for long term storage. I believe a person could start the ice maker in the morning and have enough ice in the machine for 1-2 people to have ice in their drinks thru the day.
customer_reviews.author: Biochemx

customer_reviews.title: Don't give up!
customer_reviews.text: FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS. DON'T GIVE UP. It will take awhile. You need to turn on and let sit for 1 hour. We almost gave up.... but it works!!
customer_reviews.author: Pinkcat

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Spoke several times with this company before buying this product, they were very responsive and helpful and prompt to answer any and all of my questions. Absolutely love the new color for this model. It will match a "vintage" feel of our RV very well. Ran several cycles with it already, love the size on the big ice cubes, those will help top off our coolers and drinks very nicely while camping. Unit was really fast too, was actually surprised by that. Have recommended this unit to many others in our RV group.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Mattingly

customer_reviews.title: so far so good..
customer_reviews.text: yesterday i received this.. i was nervous because it made one batch and then stopped.. and so i watched it carefully. and gave it time for the refridgerant to settle and all that before i started it back up..and its been pumping ice out ever since. i love this ice maker. hopefully it lasts for years to come.. i did purchase the 3 year insurance plan on this sinxce reviews were mixed.. just to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Used to work great
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in Early May (its now 28th of July) I used it a few weekends while camping. It was an absolute game changer. not having to worry about running out of ice. and always having fresh ice for our drinks. Love it. then we came home it sat on the counter unused and we plugged it in worked great for a short time then just stopped making ice. I am past the return window and am chatting with Amazon customer service rep at the moment. We will see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: Happymacarts

customer_reviews.title: Test it twice before keeping! WORST Company ever!
customer_reviews.text: First purchased, I did the preliminary ice test, it worked great. Fast forward to our first summer party...it leaks and the ice melts before the next batch even drops! No longer have the packaging for a return. Buyer beware: KEEP PACKAGING MATERIAL...just in case. UPDATE: Contacted manufacturer directly, sent the unit in for repair, and NEVER HEARD BACK FROM THEM! Did not receive my unit back. Worst customer service experience ever. I would give them no stars if it was a possibility!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Rix

customer_reviews.title: Barely Last A Year...
customer_reviews.text: This ice machine worked great for the first year and then it suddenly stopped working. We had a repairman look at it and discovered the relay switch was defective and needed to be replaced. Unfortunately the warranty is only good for a year and the repair was going to be quite an expense and not worth the fix. Very disappointed that this ice machine barely lasted a year and now I'm out $215...I thought this was a higher quality ice maker, but I was clearly wrong. I'm going to buy a cheaper one next time...ice makers just don't seem to last long, especially this particular model.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: It's ok, but pretty slow at making ice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a convenience item so that I wouldn't have to go to the store every time I needed ice in bulk - almost every weekend. I figured at 28 lbs a day I could harvest at least 12lbs per day. I was wrong. It is slower at making ice than my refrigerator and the ice comes out pretty wet. I am not exactly sure how much ice it's making a day but it's probably in the region of 7-9lbs over the 14 hours I am there to check it, fill and empty when needed. The ambient temp in my house is about 76 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Skyler76

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Ice
customer_reviews.text: My old ice maker died, so I got this one. I love how nice the ice cubes are, not too thin. I was amazed at how quickly it makes ice. And it looks so nice, which is not a necessity but an added bonus. I had my old ice maker to compare and this is by far the best.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon Lady

customer_reviews.title: Im not buying ice anymore!!
customer_reviews.text: Compact. Cleans good. Makes good size ice. At my job.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Definitely makes ice quickly. Its a bit large on ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely makes ice quickly. Its a bit large on our countertop and loud when ice drops into the basket. And you have to remember to immediately use the ice or take the ice basket and put it into your freezer quickly or it will all melt. Wish that this kept the ice dry and hard for longer or had a small freezer component that would keep longer. Ice is a bit wet and melty. I'm used to our icemaker in the freezer and prefer that but when it broke, we didn't want to replace the whole fridge freezer so thought this would be a reasonable option in the interim. It works well enough and makes cubes quickly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Montour

customer_reviews.title: I love how quick it makes ice
customer_reviews.text: I love how quick this unit makes ice and the three different sizes. It is also a beautiful looking machine. The only issue I have found with two types of ice machines like this is the ice is quite wet and will clump together when you mix it in with your ice in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Casciaro

customer_reviews.title: Nonfunctional
customer_reviews.text: Worked great initially. First used it beginning of march, and this week it has stopped functioning. No matter the amount of water in the machine it prompts the "add water" and won't make any ice cubes. The tray that also holds the water to freeze during the cycle is already bent. Upon reading more reviews it sounds like this is a common problem.
customer_reviews.author: jenessa kyarsgaard

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: If you read the reviews for this , they all say same. This machine works. IT takes a little more time to make ICE, than advertised. IT does not make ICE for you to throw a party, but as long as IT has water and its on, IT Will keep making ICE
customer_reviews.author: Gennys Restituyo

customer_reviews.title: Other reviewers spot on!
customer_reviews.text: The ice maker in my fridge is not connected to a waterline so thought this portable countertop ice maker a good idea. I read the reviews and was impressed. So far I found it to be everything as promised. It does a great job of making ice cubes in a hurry and I just make them until my freezer container is full, then turn it off until my supply begins to run low. I do agree that the cubes are a bit soft when first made but a short time in the freezer firms them up. I would heartily recommend this ice maker to anyone and have told all my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Marti Stanley

customer_reviews.title: OMG an icemaker that works, .... and KEEPS working !!!
customer_reviews.text: After having purchased a very similar looking unit that quickly failed, we were apprehensive in trying again. If you look closely at MANY of the models they look very similar, leading to the conclusion that perhaps they are all manufactured by the same manufacturer and possibly re-branded. Although similar looking the NewAir unit works like a charm, and continues to do so. Easy to fill, easy to drain, works quietly until it dumps the ice but quiet the rest of the time. 3 ice sizes, all good, we leave it on large, and keep filling up the ice container. No more trips to buy ice !!!
customer_reviews.author: DBB

customer_reviews.title: Not for daily use.
customer_reviews.text: Read ALL the reviews. If you are looking for an ice maker to use once in a while then you might like this. If you want to make ice often stay away. Impossible to clean upper area. After six months it struggled to make ice. After 9 months it quit all together. I only used filtered water in it. I do not recommend this at all. Again, don’t ignore the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Barclay

customer_reviews.title: Great for full apartments, not studios.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this because our apartment complex did NOT provide an ice maker in the freezer. Makes a good amount of ice (about as much as could fill a small loaf-pan) and is simple enough to refill and clean. Downside is it's somewhat noisy when it's working and goes through cycles with its fans, internal components, and pumps. Also, to be clear, it is not cooled actively, it makes ice and then the ice keeps the interior cool, so only fill as much water as you need so the heat capacitance of the water reservoir doesn't melt your ice as soon as its made.
customer_reviews.author: dcheeseman

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! This is the second one I have owned, the last one I had for years and it finally wore out. Definately got my moneys worth out of it. I love the color of this one, it is very cheery in my kitchen, takes up less space than a microwave and makes ice quicker than the ice maker in my refrigerator. We use a lot of ice and I bag up the extra for boating or fishing or whatever. The secret to large, quick ice cubes is to put cold water in it, I keep a pitcher of water in the refrigerator for when I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: I like the choice of ice sizes
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these already because they last exactly 22 months. I like the choice of ice sizes. I love the size of the ice bucket. Other than their durability, it is a great machine. It is very disappointing because I had to buy a third ice maker this week and went with a different brand. It is much smaller but it was also half the price of this one. I can't keep buying new ice makers every 22 months.
customer_reviews.author: Lovetoshop

customer_reviews.title: Newair ice maker
customer_reviews.text: I've been through several brands over the years all last about 10 months to 2 years. Only had this one for about 2 months so far its doing well. very quiet compared to the other brands I had. produces ice quickly. In one years time we will see!
customer_reviews.author: Fairchase

customer_reviews.title: Mancave Ice
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for the wetbar in the mancave. It is amazing how fast this makes ice and how easy it is to keep up with a crowd of people, or just my husband who loves to much ice. I would recommend this to anyone who want to have ice on demand.
customer_reviews.author: Ducky

customer_reviews.title: Makes ice quickly
customer_reviews.text: Performed as advertised. Makes ice quickly and easily. Keeps us in ice throughout our dinner parties. Much more convenient than bags of drippy ice.
customer_reviews.author: Fred P. Slack

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money it not worth what they are asking
customer_reviews.text: Well it was not worth the $189.00 we paid for it it did not even last 2 years it was not cost effective I would of been $80 ahead to stop and buy ice at the store once a week. And it started slowing down making like 6 months ago. And it has been running now for 12 hours and has bearly made a small glass of ice
customer_reviews.author: DEBRA ANN WORSTELL

customer_reviews.title: Quick tip - for more ice
customer_reviews.text: We bought this icemaker for our office of 10 people for ice-coffee in the morning. It works great. I read the top-rated reviews so i don't want to duplicate. In short - a tip - insert the included ice-scoop vertically on the right over the metal mini-rod... that mini-rod is a temperature sensor that detect whether the ice-machine is "full" -- by covering it with the scoop, you not only keep the scoop handle above the ice and clean, you keep the machine churning out ice. As past reviews state, if there is too much ice, it either pauses/stops or the ice melts back into the water-feed-pool/bucket.
customer_reviews.author: wwad

customer_reviews.title: Will pay for itself
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible! We make ice during the week to use on our weekend camping trips. This will easily pay for itself making our own vs. buying bags at the store. My only complaint and it's not a huge issue is the noise it makes when it drops the ice into the collection basket. I'm not sure if a different basket material would improve this. Very pleased with the consistency and production of ice this unit produces. The stainless steel finish is great quality and indicator lights easily display when it's full and needs to be dumped or when the water level is low.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Gary

customer_reviews.title: Does not appear to be working
customer_reviews.text: Just delivered this item as a gift, however it is not producing ice. Wrote to the company directly to eliminate possible user error was to play, however plan to excahnge the item. Regarding looks, the stainless steel and size fit nicely on the kitchen counter .
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: ... ago and after the first few batches it worked great. The first few batches the ice was really
customer_reviews.text: Bought this unit two years ago and after the first few batches it worked great. The first few batches the ice was really, really, small. Put it away for the winter and got it back out again, and it worked wonderfully - for three weeks. Of course it's summer now when I want to use it. It keeps shutting off... for the price it should have lasted longer! Very disappointed. It was a major decision to purchase this due to the price. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Terri E

customer_reviews.title: One year to the day then RIP
customer_reviews.text: I ordered on July 11, 2017 and it completely died on July 12, 2018. Worked great for one-year. Started making some different sounds lately, I think maybe the pump has gone bad. I haven't had time to dig in yet though.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Ice-Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is truly an excellent ice-maker. The important fact that I learned from another buyer is to let the ice maker sit for 24 hours before filling it. That lets all the parts settle. If you do this you will have no trouble with this excellent piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Miller

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Ice maker
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Ice maker. Even though your not supposed too, I left this on all the time 24/7 and it lasted for 1.5years. Makes a ton of ice in minutes and automatically stops if the bucket is full. Don't use tap water! Only use bottled water, this is because it is not easy to clean but if you use clean and bottled water, this wont be too much of an issue until the ice maker is at the end of its life anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Katianie

customer_reviews.title: Don't ever buy a Samsung refrigerator!
customer_reviews.text: The ice maker in the Samsung refrigerators has a class action suit against them because the ice maker is crap! I finally shut it off and use this sweet thing to make ice. Only comment is stay on top of the ice dropping as it does start to melt pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine just passed the warrantee and it doesn’t freeze ...
customer_reviews.text: Great machine just passed the warrantee and it doesn’t freeze anymore. If you don’t mind buying a new one each year and a half I would buy this. The write seem to indicate they don’t last much longer and you can’t talk to any one about it
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Used it every day for two years.
customer_reviews.text: We used this ice maker on the daily for two years. Two years and almost two weeks exactly. It finally stopped working as of today. It is not drawing up any water and the shovel portion is not moving properly. We USED this machine. A lot. It made ice quickly and efficiently. I cannot complain about this one bit. It is a machine used for partied primarily but we put this to the test running it every day. Sad to see it go. AM considering buying another but may prefer a larger capacity machine .
customer_reviews.author: Marla

customer_reviews.title: 10lbs of ice in 10 hours...
customer_reviews.text: Might be good for home, but not for RV/Touring/Van life. To make 10lbs of ice, which is about 1/2 of what I need every 4 days when it's warm at all, I need to run it 10 hours. So to fill up my ice, I need to plug it into a 110 outlet and run it for 20 hours straight... it does not make ice fast enough, but it definitely does make ice. I'd guess this would keep up with 2 people drinking coctails, but not for much else.
customer_reviews.author: Creeks Pub

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Love the convenience of having ice on hand, anytime. Pros: Beautiful machine. Looks great on the counter. Starts making ice within 15 minutes of putting water into chamber & continues to crank it out. Convenience. Very quiet operation. Cons: Ice is wet, & therefore sticks together when frozen requiring whacking it to break it apart for use. Stopper for water outlet is tiny & clear colored. Wish a second stopper had been included as the potential for losing it seems high. There seems to be only a slight difference between small & large size ice with all of it being on the large size.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Tharpe

customer_reviews.title: Small ice cubes
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, I like the machine but it has its drawbacks. The ice cubes at their largest size are hollow and bullet shaped and small. Need a lot of them if you want to make a frozen drink therefore this is not the product for you. Also, it is quite noisy and takes quite a while to fill its tiny basket with cubes so dont compare this to the ones you make in a tray. Over all though, it does work but I am finding myself using the ones from the tray in my freezer, not this heavy, bulky machine. I gave it 4 stars because it pretty much does what it says it is going to do.
customer_reviews.author: R. Falciani

customer_reviews.title: Quality icemaker for home use
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my icemaker weekly for 4 months. I run it for a few hours to make enough ice for me for one week. I have discovered that using refrigerated water helps make the first batch as firm as the last batch, so "cubes" don't form one giant clump once I move them to the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this little ice maker to support an office staff that drinks a lot of water. No one has a lot of time so we were not prepared to do a lot of maintenance. This ice maker exceeded our expectations. You just need to keep it filled with water and it does the rest. The front panel lets you know when it's full of ice or when it needs more water. We love it. Update: Unfortunately, it punked out at one year which changes my perception of the buy...
customer_reviews.author: A. D. Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: Makes ice quickly and a lot of it but...
customer_reviews.text: Makes ice rapidly and in a shape that I much prefer over my refrigerator's half-moon ones. My only complaint is that the ice melts in the storage bin, which is not refrigerated. If you take the ice out as soon as it's made and put it in the freezer, it sticks together and you have to break it up to use in a glass - again a result of the storage area not being refrigerated. I don't know if there is another model that has a cooled storage compartment, but I'm going to keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: Priced right
customer_reviews.text: Excellent so far...this we bought after using the first one for 5 years. Same brand and model cycles ice about every 8-10 minutes. The two of us use about 1 gallon of water through it daily fiquring if we bought 10 pounds a day it would pay for itself in about 6 months, without driving to the store. Plus they're always fresh. The old machine I figure I can fix ( the plastic water tray cracked) and use it for back up or make lemon ice for drinks or just have a backup unit.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit in April of 2012. It is still going strong and has never given me any problems. I was at first somewhat nonplussed to find that the refrigeration unit shuts off whenever the ice tray is full. The ice cubes then start to melt slightly. But, this is actually a blessing, since the refrigeration unit isn't running 24/7 (therefore, less energy consumption and wear-and-tear). You just need to clear ice cubes from the small thermocouple probe on the right of the ice hopper and the unit will restart. This has been one of my best-ever Amazon purchases!
customer_reviews.author: rjm1604

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So, I almost didn't purchase this due to some of the reviews on the item, luckily no problem so far. It's been almost a month now, I use this in a basement bar where it's typically cooler and it gets use 3-4 times a week. My opinions are this. Good Fast ice making (5-6 minutes) Clean appearance Easy operation Nice size cubes (both medium & large) Ease of cleaning Low energy use Ice stays frozen for 2-3 hours in hopper Bad A little noisy for some applications (fine for my use Tempermental when in warm areas (longer freeze time, ice melts) I'll update this review if it is found to later have problems.
customer_reviews.author: Casey L Colvin

customer_reviews.title: I removed it from all the boxes and then let it sit for 24 hrs just like the gentleman on the site mentioned and he was ...
customer_reviews.text: As soon as it arrived, I removed it from all the boxes and then let it sit for 24 hrs just like the gentleman "Big B" on the site mentioned and he was great and I'm glad he put the comment out there for all who would purchased this product. And it did work wonderfully so all is great!! Thank you again for your assistance.
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this unit 5 years ago and it just failed. We actually used the unit only 2 months a year so it actually failed after 10 months much too fast. Also the unit is noisy we had to turn it off every night or it would wake us up.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Dave.

customer_reviews.title: i loved the machine while it worked
customer_reviews.text: i loved the machine while it worked, I bought it and it broke right away, amazon sent me another machine before i had the chance to send it back which was wonderful, It worked great but broke a week after the yr warranty. It put out ice constantly
customer_reviews.author: LINDA MOORE

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed this little ice maker and was really beneficial to have however it broke after about 7-8 months. We are not sure why as our last one placed in exact same area and same usage load lasted for many years.
customer_reviews.author: kaimu

customer_reviews.title: NO ICE
customer_reviews.text: This machine has been running for more than 72 Hours and has yet to make one ice cube?
customer_reviews.author: Voxershorts

customer_reviews.title: make sure you have a lot of counter space
customer_reviews.text: I go through a lot of ice. I live in an apt. so buying the ice maker attachment for my frig is out. This is okay but it took up too much counter space to keep out all of the time. Plus it is heavy so once you put it down, you want to leave it down. If you have the option of putting an ice maker in your frig, that is the better choice.
customer_reviews.author: BAP

customer_reviews.title: Stay away - buy a brand who will stand behind its product.
customer_reviews.text: The unit was great while it worked. But after 17 months it stopped making ice. Sent to customer care at NewAir: Their response was: "Unfortunately, we are not able to set up a warranty claim because it is already outside of the one year limited manufacturer's warranty. If the compressor is no longer freezing the water than it will be a compressor issue and that cannot be repaired." Have a great day! Customer Support So if the compressor goes, your machine goes. Stay away from this brand and buy an ice maker where the company will stand behind its product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, customer service is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item and the one I received didn't work. Had a little trouble contacting customer service but that was resolved. Excellent customer service. They sent me a replacement, express, and it is working great. I love that it is lighter weith than my old ice maker. I use it all year round. In the hot summer months, I have to use it in my tent but I place a fan behind it to help keep the coils cool. It makes ice all day long. It is quiet, I only know it's on when the ice drops. Best of all it saves me buying ice every day at the camp store. Will pay for itself the first summer.
customer_reviews.author: Camp Grandma

customer_reviews.title: This is great little units,
customer_reviews.text: This is the second unit I have purchased. I wore the first unit out after two years of constant use. It was a great machine. After ordering the new machine, it was found to be defective and needed to be returned. After some discussion with the retailer, the machine was returned, repaired and is now functioning as it was designed. I have to thank the retailer, Stores 123 for all of their help, professionalism and desire to help me with my needs. This is a good product, sold by a fantastic retailer. Yes I would absolutely recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Laczko Studio

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: Makes ice super quick. Definitely let the unit settle for 24 hours before running it. Quite noisy- almost feels like trying to talk over a dishwasher. And loud ‘thumps’ as the ice is dumped into the container. I’ve begun turning it on only an hour before use, then shutting it off when done. Does a great job, just noisy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Buy the warranty
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few counter top ice makers. I like the ice they produce because it is soft and I'm an ice chewer (better for my teeth). I guess I abuse them because I run them 24/7. I think they are designed for parties and not continual use. None have lasted more than a year. This is the first where I have purchased the 4 year warranty - hopefully this will greatly increase the value.
customer_reviews.author: FEF844

customer_reviews.title: I love this ice maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this ice maker. You can tell I love it because I am just about to order my 3 ice maker. Two years ago I originally ordered this ice maker. About 1 year later it died. So I ordered a new one. I received that one almost exactly a year ago and tonight it died. I use this ice maker very nearly every single day. Even replacing it every year it's still less expensive that all the ice I used to buy from the grocery.
customer_reviews.author: CookieRoma

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts one year, max.
customer_reviews.text: I've been through 4 of these in 4 years. They always break. Get moldy, get cleaned and break. Time to try a different company. It's such a large unit and puts out a lot of heat. When it worked it was wonderful, clean crisp ice. But now it's time to move on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, output far exceeds expectations!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Unit started up no problem. But was shipped on its side, so let stand upright overnight before turning on the first time. Wiped with light soap per directions. Using filtered water, ice is tasteless. For our office and is producing way too much ice for us! Definitely going to be handy for a party in the future! We put ice in office fridge and stays frozen overnight - so running every other day. Will see if breaks, but construciton appears sturdy and red color very sharp looking. Nice they include a scoop.
customer_reviews.author: Cheapdude

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT LAST!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This did not last 2 months. Broke.. DO NOT BUY. CRAPPY, CRAPPY,CRAPPY
customer_reviews.author: D.Perreault

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the amount and size of ice this machine makes. We already had one that would make less and smaller pieces, but this is well worth the money for the difference in how much ice you make in a day or whenever you need it! Even if it would need anything, they are easy to work on and simple in design enough that it could be figured out in short order. I gave it a 5 star because it works better than expected and is easy to operate...........how reliable it is will be another story for another review, LOL!
customer_reviews.author: Nobodyspeshul2

customer_reviews.title: ... being generous with 3 stars only because it looks great and it fit on top of my small fridge ...
customer_reviews.text: i'm being generous with 3 stars only because it looks great and it fit on top of my small fridge perfectly! however, i must have gotten a defective ice maker b/c it only made 3 cubes at a time out of the 9 it should've made. i had the machine on for 2 full days and got 3 large gallons of ziplock bag. i will be returning this and either ask for an exchange or a full refund, which ever process is easier. I am so disappointed that this didn't work out and it just wasted my time and energy. but i am still hopeful based on the reviews i saw on youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Addis Mom

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy with product, but company was GREAT about the return
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this ice maker, and so disappointed when I tried it out. After reading the instructions and following them exactly - it took FOREVER for it to produce 30 ice cubes. It was making all different sizes, and I was only interested in the small ones. I started over again, with it set on small and they continually got larger, until they were HUGE, and it still took forever for a very small amount. Although I was completely unhappy with the product, the company was fantastic about the return. I would work with this seller again
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews before making this purchase. I'll admit, I was a little nervous about it. Well, it works perfectly, six months later. We use it almost every day. As long as you empty the ice bin, you'll be fine! I dump mine into the freezer bin as it's coming out
customer_reviews.author: MomOfBoys

customer_reviews.title: The ice making version of a Keurig!
customer_reviews.text: Compact unit doesn’t require a water line...just fill with water bottles, turn on, and ice bullets that easily fit into bottles is produced in minutes! My maintenance crew LOVES it! Runs on standard 110/120v outlet, and operates similar to a Keurig coffee maker! Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: AJ Alford

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, won't die
customer_reviews.text: It's been well over a year (almost 2) and this thing has never been turned off except to clean. DO make sure you clean it but otherwise it just keeps kicking out ice. My wife loves it. I find it a bit noisy, but I've expected it to die for a long time and it keeps kicking. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect as your main icemaker or as supplement to your freezer's icemaker
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed! Our freezer doesn't have an icemaker, so we took a chance on this countertop model. It performs exactly as advertised and is stunningly easy to use. It makes pounds of ice from a minimal amount of water.
customer_reviews.author: C.T. Rybka

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this purchase and have had no problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading reviews of all the affordable portable ice makers. I am very happy with this purchase and have had no problems. I took other reviewers advise and let it sit overnight before using it. There is only one issue I have with this machine and that is when I go to dump the ice in my ice bucket there is a good amount of water in the bin that collects the ice. Other than that I love it and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CindyB

customer_reviews.title: Had to replace 2 units, but it’s working now
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these ice machines for my office. After about a week of use the first one stopped working. The “add more water” light was illuminated when the machine was full. It would not produce ice. I requested a replacement and once I got the replacement the second ice machine started doing the same thing. I now have 2 replacement units and they appear to be working well. If we can keep it working, it’s a great unit and serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: mj25311

customer_reviews.title: it WAS a awesome product,  but now, just crap, fix the problem!
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through 4 of this model over the years, hey things don't last forever, without a problem, I bought one for my bro years ago and he loved it. Bought one for a friend last Christmas, then mine died so I bought another for us,, It sucks!!! And the one I bought for my friend said the same. What happened to this product!!! It was great for so long, and now, takes all day to make a cube!!!
customer_reviews.author: Greg schultz

customer_reviews.title: Works for one year then dies - Twice
customer_reviews.text: First one purchased in April 2014 to place in an employee break room. It lasted 12 months and a week. Purchased another in May 2015, it lasted 13 months. Seems to be a pattern of getting one year of life out of these. Would not recommend if you want ice available all the time. Might be ok to plug in and use then unplug, but doesn't last to leave running on your counter. Will definitely try another brand as we are 0-2 with NewAir.
customer_reviews.author: B. Burk

customer_reviews.title: What a Great investment. Our Ice maker in our refrigerator would ...
customer_reviews.text: What a Great investment. Our Ice maker in our refrigerator would barely make ice it had the ice maker in the door will never get another one like that, then it went out all together. So instead of buying another $1,000+ Frig. We bought this portable ice maker wow!! what a great investment it does what it says makes ice fast, 3 different sizes, wife loves it for her cappuccino. My wife loves to eat ice she will never run out now, you have to put the water in it, since the door operator still works on the frig, we just empty the ice in it and, it is a little work but sooo! worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jace

customer_reviews.title: Hooray! (Not)
customer_reviews.text: No way this makes more than 10 pounds of ice per day, but it is still a welcome appliance. Not very loud, great hollow bullets of ice. Sizes aren't that different. Wonderful to not have to run out for ice in the heat. Updated Had sat empty and unused over the winter, wiped it off and filled it up, horrid shrieking noise, seems to be at the rear vents. Really bummed. Didn't move it even, just wiped it off. Cannot find any warranty info on Amazon, will look for instructions. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Neldine

customer_reviews.title: I really liked the first one
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have purchased this ice maker. The first one had a part crack after about 18 months and it stopped working. I really liked the first one, so I bought another one. I have only been using the new one for a few weeks, and I am already having issues with the sensors that detect the ice level. This is more annoying than anything as I have to unplug the machine just to reset the sensor. I have opened up a warranty claim, so I can update the review once I hear back from the company. When this machine works correctly, it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: James F. Guenthner

customer_reviews.title: Entertainment...make ice as you go
customer_reviews.text: Love the simplicity, efficiency and quantity of this ice maker. You get what you pay for. Awesome machine. Couple this with the Heavy Duty, Stainless Steel Ice Shaver, Electric Shaved Ice Machine and make great and fast margaritas or favorite frozen drink fast. Excellent for entertainment...make a few batches and then just make ice as you go...clean put away.
customer_reviews.author: G.K.

customer_reviews.title: Good ice machine
customer_reviews.text: Love this i have had this for 5 years still working
customer_reviews.author: Josh

product_meta.title: NewAir Portable Ice Maker 28 lb. Daily, Countertop Compact Design, 3 Size Bullet Shaped Ice, AI-100BK, Black
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackThis small ice maker has an attractive and compact design that's perfect for the countertop. This simple, hassle-free ice dispenser requires no installation, is easy to set up and control, and the low water and full ice alerts let you know when it's time to make adjustments. Get your ice fast, with a quick 6 minute freezing time per cycle. The clear, restaurant-quality ice that you'll get with this ice maker not only looks great in any drink, but it also melts five times slower than cloudy ice. This portable ice maker can make up to 28lbs of bullet-shaped ice per day. 

NewAir is a company family owned since 2002. All products are tested and have the highest safety certification. Our products are backed by a one year warranty. With high-quality products and excellent customer service, NewAir is a name you can trust.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Enjoy ice cold beverages with the NewAir AI-100BK countertop portable ice maker, which produces up to 28 pounds of ice per day. This incredibly well-crafted ice maker offers a perfected design that is reliable and easy to use. As one of the best-selling ice makers, it features consistently positive reviews and excellent results. Makes Ice Quickly - Simply plug in the countertop ice maker into any standard outlet, fill it with tap or bottled water, and start enjoying fresh ice in as little as 15 minutes. Convenient Size Options - With the NewAir AI-100BK ice maker, you can select the perfect size for your ice cubes. It features 3 different size options for you to choose from. Empty Water Reservoir Indicator - This NewAir portable ice maker features an empty water reservoir indicator light that tells you when you need to add more water. Handy Scoop - For your convenience, the NewAir AI-100BK countertop icemaker comes with an ice scoop for easily filling your glass with fresh ice.

NOTE:Please let the item to sit upright for a few hours before using it to allow the compressor fluids to settle.
feature_bullets: MINI ICE MAKER - This ice makers countertop design is perfect for any small kitchen, RV, boat or bar
STYLISH DESIGN - This compact ice maker machine has a modern design and comes in fun fashion colors
WORKS FAST - This small ice machine is simple to set up, and will make fresh ice in just 15 minutes
QUALITY - This portable ice maker is made with quality materials, for restaurant-grade ice at home
NEWAIR - With good quality products and excellent customer service, NewAir is a name you can trust

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,946 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
